wikipedia_page.main: James Thie (born 27 June 1978) is a Welsh middle-distance runner specialising in the 1500 metres. He finished fourth at the 2004 World Indoor Championships.

response: |colspan=6|In a tactical ran race Korir, who had progressed from the qualifying round as a fastest loser, held off Heshko by just 3/100th's of a second with Rotich a further 1/2 second away in third. Rotich was only awarded the bronze 1 hour after the race when the athlete who had crossed the line in third place, Great Britain's Michael East, was disqualified for a pushing incident. Other finalists were Abdelkader Hachlaf Morocco (4th), James Thie Great Britain (5th), Mirosław Formela Poland (6th) and José Redolat Spain (7th) and Youssef Baba Morocco (8th).
